author: pipermerriam
content:
<@!194432762315407360> I just did https://github.com/ethereum/ddht/pull/92 which gets my implementation up to date with the test fixtures you posted here: https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/pull/157#issuecomment-694171383

It does **not** appear that those fixtures have been updated to include the reduction of `id-nonce` down to 16 bytes and the inclusion of the `iv` in the signed data.  (can you confirm).  Would it be helpful for me to regenerate those fixtures with that update?

Also, the `handshake` fixtures there are using a 64 byte ephemeral public key as opposed to the 33 byte compressed version.  Is that intentional?

author: pipermerriam
content: The only change I had to make to my implementation was updating the handshake header packet to include the `aes_gcm_nonce` field which wasn't previously part of the header.  Are there other changes that I should be aware of (other than the `id-nonce/iv` one I already mentioned)

author: pipermerriam
content: Another question.  How far are you on your implementation.  Any chance you're at a point where you could spin up a bootnode for us to test our's against?

author: pipermerriam
content: There was also a suggestion in the spec to restrict the size of `request_id` which I support but doesn't seem to be represented.  4-bytes seems like plenty.  2-bytes is probably enough since request ids can be recycled and we definitely aren't going to have more than 65535 in-flight requests for a single peer at any given time .  I'm üëç on making this change.
